com.vaadin.polymer.iron

Interface IronRequestElement

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Element, EventTarget, HTMLElement, Node

    @JsType(isNative=true)
public interface IronRequestElement
extends HTMLElement

    iron-request can be used to perform XMLHttpRequests.

    <iron-request id="xhr"></iron-request>
 ...
 this.$.xhr.send({url: url, body: params});

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String SRC 
      static String TAG 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void abort()
      Aborts the request.
      boolean getAborted()
      Aborted will be true if an abort of the request is attempted.
      com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject getCompletes()
      A promise that resolves when the xhr response comes back, or rejects
      if there is an error before the xhr completes.
      boolean getErrored()
      Errored will be true if the browser fired an error event from the
      XHR object (mainly network errors).
      com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject getProgress()
      An object that contains progress information emitted by the XHR if
      available.
      com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject getResponse()
      A reference to the parsed response body, if the xhr has completely
      resolved.
      double getStatus()
      A reference to the status code, if the xhr has completely resolved.
      String getStatusText()
      A reference to the status text, if the xhr has completely resolved.
      boolean getTimedOut()
      TimedOut will be true if the XHR threw a timeout event.
      com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject getXhr()
      A reference to the XMLHttpRequest instance used to generate the
      network request.
      com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject parseResponse()
      Attempts to parse the response body of the XHR.
      com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject send(Object options)
      Sends an HTTP request to the server and returns the XHR object.

      Aborted will be true if an abort of the request is attempted.

      XHR object (mainly network errors).

      available.

      A reference to the status code, if the xhr has completely resolved.

      TimedOut will be true if the XHR threw a timeout event.

      • send

        com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject send(Object options)

        Sends an HTTP request to the server and returns the XHR object.

        The handling of the body parameter will vary based on the Content-Type
        header. See the docs for iron-ajax’s body param for details.

        JavaScript Info:
        Parameters:
        {{url: - string, method: (string|undefined), async: (boolean|undefined), body: (ArrayBuffer|ArrayBufferView|Blob|Document|FormData|null|string|undefined|Object), headers: (Object|undefined), handleAs: (string|undefined), jsonPrefix: (string|undefined), withCredentials: (boolean|undefined)}} options
        Returns:
        {JavaScriptObject}

      • abort

        void abort()

        Aborts the request.

        JavaScript Info:

      • parseResponse

        com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject parseResponse()

        Attempts to parse the response body of the XHR. If parsing succeeds,
        the value returned will be deserialized based on the responseType
        set on the XHR.

        JavaScript Info:
        Returns:
        {JavaScriptObject}
